page.title: 11St.Mark's Church
page.content: { St.Mark's School-Church, Handley}was opened in 1870 for the Ogston Estate. In 1970 the new school was built. The Church is ministered by{Reverend {Letford,}Priest in Charge of Clay Cross Parish, assisted by two lay readers. There is a{church service} every week, usually at 6.30 p.m.The school children are having their harvest service in St.Mark's this year. Several village clubs now meet in the old school rooms. The{Christian Fellowship}meets on the 2nd Tuesday in the month and it was formed 12 years ago. They help care for one another and find out who needs help.They started the{Leytonfields {Club.}(See next page) The building is also used for{Women's {Institute,}the{Youth Club}and{Parish {Council}meetings.
